Activation

Class Activation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activation.Activation

  • public class Activation
extends java.lang.Object
    An activation is an instance of a method. variables is an array of Values, these are used to hold values for locals and parameters in this activation. Parameters are stored from address 0..n if the method is static, and 1..n+1 if the method is non static. The local variables follow the parameters.

      Thread counter counts how many threads are running

    • Constructor Detail

      • Activation

        public Activation(Method thisCode,
          int returnAddress,
          Method returnCode,
          OperandStack operandStack,
          Class cl)
        Created a new activation record based on a method. Creates a new variables array, and filles it with the incoming parameter values from the operand stack, and null for all the local variables.
        Parameters:
        thisCode - the method that this activation is an instance of.
        returnAddress - the value of pc at the time the new activation was created, this is also the return address of the method call.
        returnCode - the method from which this method was called.
        operandStack - a stack of Values that holds the parameters.
        cl - the class of the method associated with this activation.
        See Also:
        Method, Value, OperandStack

      • getVar

        public Value getVar(int address)
        Returns an object of type Value or one of its subclasses. Produces an error if the address is too large. This method is only used for the iinc instruction.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the variable of parameter. Used as index into the variables array.

      • setVar

        public void setVar(Value val,
          int address)
        Stores a value object in the variables array at address 'address'. This method is only used by iinc.
        Parameters:
        val - An object of type Value.
        address - the address where the value held in the parameter val will be stored.

      • print

        public void print(java.io.PrintWriter pw)

      • print_

        public void print_(java.io.PrintWriter pw)

      • store

        public void store(int type,
         int address,
         OperandStack operandStack)
        Stores the value of the top element of the operand stack into the activation record. The storage location is determined by the address.

        Produces an error message if the address is too large, or if the type of the element on the top of the stack does not match with the type of what ever element is already stored at that address (the value could be null, in that case no type checking is done!)

        Parameters:
        type -
        address -
        operandStack -

      • load

        public void load(int type,
        int address,
        OperandStack operandStack)
        Loads a value from the activation record onto the top of the stack. The address determines which value is pushed onto the stack.

        An error is produced if the addres is too large, if the value stored at that address in the activation is null, or if the type of the value stored at the address does not match the type parameter.

        Parameters:
        type -
        address -
        operandStack -
